member.name: IXAudio2SourceVoice.Discontinuity
member.summary: Notifies an XAudio2 voice that no more buffers are coming after the last one that is currently in its queue.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful, an error code otherwise.

member.name: IXAudio2SourceVoice.ExitLoop
member.summary: Stops looping the voice when it reaches the end of the current loop region.
member.param: Identifies this call as part of a deferred batch. See the XAudio2 Operation Sets overview for more information.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful, an error code otherwise. See XAudio2 Error Codes for descriptions of XAudio2 specific error codes.

member.name: IXAudio2SourceVoice.FlushSourceBuffers
member.summary: Removes all pending audio buffers from the voice queue.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful, an error code otherwise.

member.name: IXAudio2SourceVoice.GetFrequencyRatio
member.summary: Returns the frequency adjustment ratio of the voice.
member.param: Returns the current frequency adjustment ratio if successful.

member.name: IXAudio2SourceVoice.GetState
member.summary: Returns the voice's current cursor position data.
member.param: Pointer to an structure containing the state of the voice.

Flags controlling which voice state data should be returned. Valid values are 0 or XAUDIO2_VOICE_NOSAMPLESPLAYED. The default value is 0. If you specify XAUDIO2_VOICE_NOSAMPLESPLAYED, GetState returns only the buffer state, not the sampler state. GetState takes roughly one-third as much time to complete when you specifyXAUDIO2_VOICE_NOSAMPLESPLAYED.

member.name: IXAudio2SourceVoice.SetFrequencyRatio
member.summary: Sets the frequency adjustment ratio of the voice.
member.param: Frequency adjustment ratio. This value must be between XAUDIO2_MIN_FREQ_RATIO and the MaxFrequencyRatio parameter specified when the voice was created (see ). XAUDIO2_MIN_FREQ_RATIO currently is 0.0005, which allows pitch to be lowered by up to 11 octaves.
Identifies this call as part of a deferred batch. See the XAudio2 Operation Sets overview for more information.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful, an error code otherwise. See XAudio2 Error Codes for descriptions of error codes.

member.name: IXAudio2SourceVoice.SetSourceSampleRate
member.summary: Reconfigures the voice to consume source data at a different sample rate than the rate specified when the voice was created.
member.param: The new sample rate the voice should process submitted data at. Valid sample rates are 1kHz to 200kHz.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful, an error code otherwise. See XAudio2 Error Codes for descriptions of error codes.

member.name: IXAudio2SourceVoice.Start
member.summary: Starts consumption and processing of audio by the voice. Delivers the result to any connected submix or mastering voices, or to the output device.
member.param: Flags that control how the voice is started. Must be 0.
Identifies this call as part of a deferred batch. See the XAudio2 Operation Sets overview for more information.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful, an error code otherwise. See XAudio2 Error Codes for descriptions of XAudio2 specific error codes.

member.name: IXAudio2SourceVoice.Stop
member.summary: Stops consumption of audio by the current voice.

param.name: Flags
param.para: Flags that control how the voice is stopped. Can be 0 or the following:

listheader.description: Continue emitting effect output after the voice is stopped.

member.param: Identifies this call as part of a deferred batch. See the XAudio2 Operation Sets overview for more information.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful, an error code otherwise. See XAudio2 Error Codes for descriptions of XAudio2 specific error codes.

member.name: IXAudio2SourceVoice.SubmitSourceBuffer
member.summary: Adds a new audio buffer to the voice queue.
member.param: Pointer to an structure to queue.
Pointer to an additional structure used when submitting WMA data.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful, an error code otherwise. See XAudio2 Error Codes for descriptions of XAudio2 specific error codes.

member.name: IXAudio2SourceVoice
member.summary: Use a source voice to submit audio data to the XAudio2 processing pipeline.You must send voice data to a mastering voice to be heard, either directly or through intermediate submix voices.
